chargeHist.descr: Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle as repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. SCOTT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: Matter is held open for two weeks. Parties to request a hearing if needed.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or job search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any bars or liquor stores.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-12-14 at 3:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Collin Bastian, on 11-02-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of injury by intoxicated use of vehicle.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety, not operate a motor vehicle and have no contact with Collin Bastian, Blake Bastian, Richard Douglas, Tyler Hoffman and Michael Gadzinski.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
